ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark
ygData.msgSnippet: True they locked those who played in the beta on Kunark.  The boats didn t exist till very late. Bottom line:  None of the bards ever hit 53 so there was never
ygData.messageBody:
True they locked those who played in the beta on Kunark. The boats didn't
exist till very late.

Bottom line: None of the bards ever hit 53 so there was never a need for a
vendor to buy parry from
----- Original Message -----
From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2000 11:09 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark


> I was under the impression that the reason they but trainers on Kunark was
> that for the beta, all testers were unable to leave Kunark. Granted, I was
> not a tester so I can't say.
>
> Drae
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2000 10:27 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark
>
>
> Umm not true:
>
> There is a Bard Song Vendor in Kunark. There aren't any trainers because
we
> didn't get any skills after 50 (till 53). Those skills that were thrown
in
> were an after thought and the bards in the beta just went to kelethin on
the
> elven boat (or grabbed a gate/port) to train.
>
> There is a high level song vendor in Kunark so there were bards in the
beta
> test of Kunark. By and large we don't have any Kunark specific issues
> (except that of singing steel) and you can hardly expect 500-1000 beta
> testers (I'm not really sure how many of us there were) to catch the
singing
> steel issue in a 5 week timeframe ;)
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur
> Bard of Norrath since Beta 2
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Peck White" <pwhite@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2000 9:35 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark
>
>
> > Sad but apparently true.
> >
